D891009-d-10-05-89-BAR.Narrative: THE TRACK AT THE POD IS AT THE BOTTOM OF A SLIGHT SAG WITH A LONG UPGRADE STARTING HERE SOUTHBOUND.THERE IS A SHORT 40 MPH SLOW ORDER HERE. THE TRACK CURVES TO THE RIGHT AS YOU FACE SOUTH. THE RAIL IS115# WITH SIX HOLE ANGLE BARS, JOINTS HALF STAGGERED. THE OUTSIDE RAIL IS SOMEWHAT CURVEWORN.ELEVATION AND GAGE JUST NORTH OF POD IS NORMAL. THE LEAD TRUCK OF THE SOUTH CAR (BAR 621) FORCED THE RAILON THE OUTS-IDE OF THE CURVE (EAST RAIL) OUT ENOUGH TO ALLOW ONE OF THE WEST WHEELS OF THAT TRUCK TODROP TO THE TIES; THE TRIAN CONTINUED ON APPROXIMATELY 700 MORE FEET WHEN THE WHOLE THING PILED UPAND STOPPED IN THE FOLLOWING SEQUENCE: THE LEAD CAR WAS ON ITS SIDE WITH THE SOUTH END JUST IN THE CLEAR, THE NORTH END WAS IN THE EAST DITCH 20 FEET FROM THE EDGE OF THE TRACK. THE LEAD TRUCK OF THISCAR WAS STRADDLING THE EAST RAIL WITHIN A FEW FEET OF THE END OF ITS CAR. TRACKS IN THE TIES INDICATED THAT THIS TRUCK HAD STILL BEEN TRACKING JUST INSIDE THE WEST RAIL TO WITHIN 20 FEET OF ITS FINALRESTING PLACE. NO PRIMARY CAUSE CODE AVAILABLE FOR THIS INCIDENT.NoneNoneNoneNone
